As in previous moments in our nation‚Äôs history, such as when the Supreme Court attempted to overturn the New Deal, a defense of our democracy requires dramatic action on behalf of the people.

In response to this judicial overreach, Congress must restrain the runaway Supreme Court. The President and Democrats in Congress should act immediately to expand the court to ensure it regains legitimacy with the majority of Americans.
This radical doctrine could lead to rolling back decades of gains made by working people and turn back the clock to the 1920s.
In their decision to gut the administrative state in West Virginia v. EPA, and overturn Roe, SCOTUS has joined the far-right war against working people and representative democracy.

Instead of responding to their tenuous claim to legitimacy with a modest approach, this court has instead decided to overrule decades of precedent, usurp the authority of the legislative and executive branches, and ignore the supermajority of public opinion.

This Supreme Court ‚Äúmajority‚Äù includes 5 members nominated by Presidents who lost the popular vote and three members nominated by a President may have engaged in seditious treason for his role in inciting the Jan 6 attack on the Capitol.

It‚Äôs a direct assault on the people‚Äôs government ability to restrain corporate interests. This ruling shows that the Supreme Court ‚Äúmajority‚Äù has been captured by corporate interests and is loyal to fossil fuel CEOs and right-wing billionaires, not the constitution.
